conclusion: Principles of shadow formation and effects of light source position on shadow characteristics
Shadow A is cast by the cylindrical object with a circular base
Shadow B is cast by the small, irregularly shaped object
Shadow C is cast by the larger, circular object
Shadow D is cast by the triangular object
Current light source position causes shadows to be cast to the left and slightly forward
Shadows will shift towards the back left when the light source moves to the front right
Shadows will become longer due to more oblique light rays relative to the objects
Shadow A will move towards the back left and become longer and more elongated
Shadow B will move towards the back left and become longer and more elongated
Shadow C will move towards the back left and become longer and more elongated
Shadow D will move towards the back left and become longer and more elongated
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the back left and become longer and more elongated
